item.title: Report E-2025010430
item.description:
Report E-2025010430

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-02
  • City: CARTERSVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ERTS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 17:59 EST on 1/2, XPO-NRG contacted ERTS to report a spill of less than 1 ounce of "ZEP MORADO SUPER CLEANER" from a 5-gallon poly pail. The pail was damaged due to a packaging error by the shipper and only affected the outer surface of the pail. The spill was cleaned before notifying ERTS. ERTS generated waste ID: 224080-1 and staged in for terminal personnel to handle.

item.title: Report E-2025010408
item.description:
Report E-2025010408

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-06
  • City: Cedar Springs
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This customer has a process in place where we scan multiple items on the trailer and customer set up before a lock code is given to unlock the fill line to be able to deliver. If that process isn't followed the driver is to call in and go through some manual verifications. That didn't happen and the unload should not have happened. Additionally a customer rep unlocked the fill line for him further bypassing protocols and they knew there was too much product for the tank to hold and that it would be a partial unload. The rep was going to tell him when to shut down. Ultimately that communication didn't happen and 3-4 gallons overflowed the tank down the sides and into the containment area. The rep rinsed down the sides of the tank into the containment drain.

item.title: Report I-2025010083
item.description:
Report I-2025010083

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-23
  • City: Atlanta
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Delta's DG Management Group was notified of an e-Cig(vape pen) overheat event during flight of DL836/23Dec2024 (ATL-PHX). A passengers vape pen overheated and smoke/fire was observed. The passenger used water to mitigate the fire. A responding Flight Attendant used a fire containment bag to further provide fire protection. No injuries were reported. The flight continued to destination without further incident. The NRC and FAA were notified.
